alert.note: Alert for Durham (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 14 at 11:03AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of central North Carolina, including the following counties, Durham and Wake. * WHEN...Until 100 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1101 AM EDT, Heavy rain has ended, but residual ponding and rises on creeks and rivers may still lead to minor flooding. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Raleigh, Durham, Cary, RDU International, Apex, Morrisville, Research Triangle, William B Umstead State Park, Bethesda, Carpenter, Parkwood, Rollingview Marina, Gorman, Falls Lake, Falls Lake State Rec Area, Lake Wheeler and Jordan Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
